actions.text: Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Energy and Commerce.  Report No: 99-779 (Part I).

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Fossil and Synthetic Fuels

official_title: A bill authorizing natural gas and hazardous liquid pipeline safety programs for fiscal year 1987, and for other purposes.

summary.as: Reported to House amended, Part I
summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Energy and Commerce with amendment, H. Rept. 99-779 (Part I)) Amends the Natural Gas Pipeline Safety Act of 1968 to authorize grants and appropriations for FY 1987-1988 for natural gas pipeline safety programs. Amends the Hazardous Liquid Pipeline Safety Act of 1979 to authorize appropriations for FY 1987-1988 for hazardous liquid pipeline safety programs. Directs the Secretary of Transportation to promulgate regulations requiring pipeline operators to report: (1) any condition that constitutes a safety hazard; and (2) any safety-related condition causing a significant change or restriction in the operation of pipeline facilities. Requires that such reports be submitted in writing within five working days after a determination has been made that a safety hazard exists. Requires that pipeline transportation facilities maintenance plans include terms designed to enhance the ability to discover safety-related conditions and hazards.

titles.title: A bill authorizing natural gas and hazardous liquid pipeline safety programs for fiscal year 1987, and for other purposes.
